author: R Krishnamoorthy
text:
IDEAL SETTINGS:The Karuvilparaivalasu tank near Villarasanpatti in Erode is set to get a facelift.- PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

The City Corporation has proposed to give a facelift to the tank at Karuvilparaivalasu under the Central Government’s AMRUT (Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation) Scheme.

AMRUT

Located near Villarasanpatti, it is one of the few largest tanks in the city limits. Launched last year, the mega urban scheme AMRUT adopts a project approach to ensure basic infrastructure services relating to water supply, sewerage, septage management, storm water drains, transport and development of green spaces and parks with special provision for meeting the needs of children.

Boating

According to official sources, the tank would be desilted and converted into an recreation spot with boating facilities. The proposal has been routed to the Centre through the State Government, sources said.

The Corporation had recently desilted and beautified the Sadayampalayam tank near Rangampalayam, utilising Infrastructure Gap Filling Fund sanctioned to the tune of Rs. 2.5 crore during 2013-14. It was opened for use by the public last month.

Official sources said boating could not be introduced in the Sadayampalayam tank since there were rocks protruding high from the bottom. However, the scope for introducing coracle rides would be explored, sources said.
title: Karuvilparaivalasu tank in Erode to be beautified
